title: 112_hr1447
content: The Act may be cited as the "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" and establishes the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established under Subchapter II of chapter 449 of title 49, United States Code. It advises the Assistant Secretary on aviation security matters and develops recommendations for improvements to aviation security. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee develops recommendations for aviation security improvements, which are approved by working groups and transmitted to the Assistant Secretary. The committee submits periodic reports on identified matters and an annual report on activities, findings, and recommendations. The Advisory Committee, appointed by the Assistant Secretary, consists of representatives from 27 member organizations including air carriers, cargo air transportation, indirect air carriers, and labor. The Advisory Committee, appointed by the Assistant Secretary, consists of representatives from various organizations in the transportation industry, including air carriers, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and aviation technology security industry. Members serve without compensation and are subject to removal for cause. Meetings are required at least semiannually. The Assistant Secretary will establish an air cargo security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues. The group will meet quarterly and submit recommendations to improve air cargo security programs. The working group for cargo security initiatives will include members with expertise in air cargo operations and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. Additionally, a general aviation security working group will be established to provide recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities and aircraft. The working group for general aviation security at airports will meet quarterly and submit recommendations to the Advisory Committee. It will include members with expertise in general aviation and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. Additionally, an airport perimeter security working group will provide recommendations on perimeter security and access control issues. The working group for general aviation security at airports will meet quarterly to provide recommendations on improving perimeter security and access control procedures. It will include members with expertise in airport security and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Advisory Committee or its working groups. The curr_chunk defines terms related to airport security, including the Advisory Committee, annual report, Assistant Secretary, and perimeter security. It clarifies that perimeter security includes monitoring, securing, and preventing unauthorized access to an airport. The House of Representatives passed the Aviation Security Advisory Committee bill on June 28, 2012.
